revised_title: The Effect of Lutidine on Struchnine's Action on Frogs and its Antagonistic Properties
tldr: The author investigates the effects of lutidine on strychnine's action on frogs, discovering that lutidine increases the tonicity of cardiac and voluntary muscular tissue, slows heart rate, and arrests the inhibitory power of the vagus nerve. Lutidine is found to be successfully antagonistic to strychnine in its action on the spinal cord.
